prompt: <description>**Intermediate Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Flat Top and Bottom** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1 with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.1515, 0.0] Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Create a single face (face_1) and add a circle (circle_1) to the face with the following properties: - Center: [0.375, 0.375] - Radius: 0.375 Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying a rotation using the given Euler angles and a translation using the given Translation Vector. Extrude the 3D sketch along the Z-axis by a depth of 0.15 towards the normal and a depth of 0.0 opposite the normal. The sketch scale factor should be 0.75. This will create a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. The height of the cylinder is approximately twice the diameter. **Intermediate Part 2: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered End** Create a new coordinate system for part 2 with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.3525, 0.1515, 0.5253] Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Create a single face (face_1) and add a circle (circle_1) to the face with the following properties: - Center: [0.0225, 0.0225] - Radius: 0.0225 Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.045. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying a rotation using the given Euler angles and a translation using the given Translation Vector. Extrude the 3D sketch along the Z-axis by a depth of 0.705 towards the normal and a depth of 0.0 opposite the normal. The sketch scale factor should be 0.045. This will create a cylindrical object with a tapered end, resembling a pencil or a pen. The object is centered and occupies a significant portion of the image. **Intermediate Part 3: Rectangular Prism with a Cylindrical Hole** Create a new coordinate system for part 3 with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.3675, 0.1515, 0.5699] Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Create a single face (face_1) and add four lines to the face to form a rectangle. The lines should have the following start and end points: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.015, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.015, 0.0], End Point [0.015, 0.1928] - Line 3: Start Point [0.015, 0.1928], End Point [0.0, 0.1928] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.1928], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.1928. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying a rotation using the given Euler angles and a translation using the given Translation Vector. Extrude the 3D sketch along the Z-axis by a depth of 0.636 towards the normal and a depth of 0.0 opposite the normal. The sketch scale factor should be 0.1928. This will create a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The hole is slightly larger than the width of the prism. The prism is positioned at a slight angle to the viewer.</description>

Part 2: Cylindrical Hole Construct a cylindrical hole. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the Translation Vector to [0.1875, 0.0, 0.1875]. Subtract the circular shape from the prism volume created in Part 1 by extruding the circle with a depth of 0.125 units. Finalize the part by creating a new solid body from the remaining prism volume with a cylindrical hole in its center. The final dimensions for the rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in its center are approximately 3 units in length, 2 units in width, and 1 unit in height, with a cylindrical hole diameter of about 0.5 units. Given the JSON extract provided, it appears to be incomplete. You may want to ensure that you have the full JSON data for more accurate modeling.</description>
